application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: Tree 1 Back left hand corner of number 42: Fell. Tree 2 Small self sowed Sycamore: Fell.  Tree 3 European Ash tree Fell.. Tree 4 Large European Ash tree with a dead Cherry tree Fell. Tree 5 Large Ash tree: Fell. Tree 6 English Oak tree at the far back left hand corner of the garden: Crown reduce back to old reduction points, to cut the decay out, leaving all internal growth. Giving a 3m reduction leaving approx. 5 - 6m horizontal crown spread and approx. 15m vertical spread. Stripping the Ivy from the base. Tree 7 Large Horse Chestnut on the back boundary: Crown reduce back to old reduction points and remove deadwood. Giving approx. 2 - 3m reduction, leaving approx. 5 - 6m horizontal crown spread, vertical crown spread between 10 and 12m.  Tree 8 Right hand side of the back garden in the back right hand corner, European Ash tree: Fell. Tree 9 Horse Chestnut next to the European Ash tree: Crown reduce back to old reduction points. Trees 10 and 11 2no. European Ash trees on the right hand boundary: Fell. Tree 12 Western Red Cedar on the right hand side: Crown reduce by approx. third, reducing by approx. 2m vertically and laterally, leaving approx. 2m crown spread. Tree 13 Holly tree in the front garden on the right hand side: Crown reduce by approx. third. Removing approx.. 1m from the vertical and lateral branches, leaving approx. 2m crown spread. Tree 14 European Ash in the middle of the front garden: Fell.  Tree 15 Mountain Ash tree: Remove deadwood and give formative prune. Tree 16 Dead Red Robin underneath Mountain Ash tree: Fell.. Tree 17 Dead Mountain Ash tree in the garden: Fell. Tree 18 Conifer at the front of the property on the left hand side, next to the bay window: Reduce the tree by approx. 50% and trim sides. Topping the tree vertically by approx. 5m, leaving approx. 5 - 6m vertical spread. Middle of the front garden: Fell. Tree 15 Mountain Ash tree: Remove deadwood and give formative prune.
